item.title: Wilson goal helps Fulham beat 10-man Chelsea
item.description: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior watched from the stands as Harry Wilson's fine finish condemns his team to defeat by west London rivals Fulham at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Man City draw with Brighton as title bid continues to falter
item.description: Manchester City make it three games without a win, after Brighton's Kaoru Mitoma scores from outside the box to cancel out Erling Haaland's first-half penalty.

item.title: Mane strike gives Wolves deserved draw against nine-man Everton
item.description: Mateus Mane's cool finish gives Wolves a deserved draw away at Everton who had Michael Keane and Jack Grealish sent off in the second half at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

item.title: Silva delighted with 'incredible' win over Chelsea
item.description: Fulham boss Marco Silva is delighted after Harry Wilson's 81st-minute goal gave his side a deserved 2-1 win over 10-man Chelsea at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Keane's actions weren't deliberate - Moyes on red card
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes was not happy with the decision for Michael Keane to be sent off as it was "not a deliberate action", but has no sympathy for Jack Grealish who received two quick yellow cards for dissent.

item.title: Frank reflects on 'extremely painful' result at Bournemouth

item.title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola
